text.__SUMMARY__: Zamia pygmaea is a species of plant in the family Zamiaceae. It is endemic to western Cuba and Isla de la Juventud. It is the smallest gymnosperm plant. It reaches only up to a height of 25 cm above the ground. It has an underground tuberous stem.
text.Common names:
Zamia pygmaea has three common names, among which guayiga is the most common. Other names are comptie and Florida arrowroot.
